relation: CLOUDY, RAIN ALL DAY--HEAVY IN THE EVENING
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {1170=SINCE 1845, BY ACT OF CONGRESS, THE FIRST TUESDAY AFTER THE FIRST MONDAY IN NOVEMBER IS THE DATE FOR CHOOSING THE PRESIDENTIAL ELECTORS. STATE ELECTIONS ARE ALSO GENERALLY HELD ON THIS DAY. WOMEN WERE FIRST ALLOWED TO VOTE IN 1920., 2957=ELECTION DAY : PERIOD OF RECORD 119 YEARS : 1890-2008, 1447=THE HIGHEST TEMPERATURE EVER RECORDED IN BUFFALO ON ELECTION DAY WAS ON NOVEMBER 6, 1956 WHEN SUNNY SKIES WERE ACCOMPANIED BY A HIGH TEMPERATURE OF 73 DEGREES. THE COLDEST TEMPERATURE EVER RECORDED WAS ON ELECTION DAY OF 1951 WHEN ON THE MORNING OF NOVEMBER 6TH THE TEMPERATURE DROPPED TO 12 DEGREES., 2055=IN 1985, REMNANTS OF HURRICANE JUAN REACHED THE BUFFALO AREA AND RAIN BEGAN ON THE 2ND CONTINUING THROUGH THE 5TH..RESULTING IN THE WETTEST ELECTION DAY EVER__1.77 INCHES WAS RECORDED ON NOVEMBER 5TH, 1985. THE HEAVY RAINS CAUSED WIDESPREAD POOR DRAINAGE FLOODING, SMALL STREAM AND BASEMENT FLOODING, AND PUSHED MOST WATERWAYS TO NEAR BANKFUL., 2444=STEADY RAINS FELL THROUGHOUT ELECTION DAY IN 1999. THE RAINS BECAME HEAVY ACROSS EXTREME WESTERN NEW YORK DURING THE EVENING HOURS RESULTING IN URBAN FLOODING ACROSS THE TONAWANDAS, NORTH BUFFALO, AND WESTERN NIAGARA COUNTY. THE SITUATION WAS EXACERBATED BY STORM SEWERS CLOGGED WITH FALL LEAVES., 2786=IT HAS SNOWED ON 23 OF THE PAST ELECTION DAYS IN BUFFALO WITH THE MOST BEING 2.5 INCHES ON NOVEMBER 6, 2007.}
